intro: Monsonia rehmii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming dense mats or small shrubs. Its flowers bloom in shades of purple, blue, and white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Monsonia rehmii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
